title: M&S creates a 'foolproof' turkey which comes pre-stuffed and basted with de-boned thighs
text:
Marks and Spencers have created a ‘foolproof’ turkey which comes pre-stuffed and basted with de-boned thighs for customers who dread cooking Christmas dinner.

The British high street store said they've created the easy to cook turkey after feedback from over 80,000 customers around their festive food fears.

Most customers revealed that they had ‘turkey terror’ - and it wasn't just from fears that they may forget to remove the giblets. Among their main fears were overcooking the bird or ending up with an inedible turkey.

Marks and Spencers have listened to their fears and created The Perfect Turkey, which is fully prepped and will cook in two hours.

The brands Perfect Turkey doesn't need to be prepped at all, and just needs to be put in the oven for 2 hours to cook

Marks and Spencers reveals that their customers main concerns when cooking a turkey were how long to cook if for, how to make sure it’s cooked through and how to make sure it’s not dry.

While others also worried about how to carve it, stuff it and what to cook it in. So what prep has been done to the British Oakham turkey to make sure you don't have to?

The turkeys thighs have been de-boned, stuffed and then wrapped in bacon, while the crown is basted with a sage butter, under the skin, to give extra moisture to the turkey breast.

So all that's left for you to do is pop it in the oven, in its foil tin, and wait for it to all cook in two hours.

Marks and Spencers reveals that their customers main concerns when cooking a turkey were how long to cook if for, how to make sure it’s cooked through and how to make sure it’s not dry. (stock picture)

Rosie Eiduks product developer for M&S said about the turkey, which is available to pre-order now said: ‘We’ve spent over a year perfecting the Perfect Turkey to ensure our customers had the most succulent meat no matter their skillset this Christmas.

'Looking at stuffing ratios and meticulously selecting the optimum sized bird to ensure perfection every time. It really will reduce the turkey terror this Christmas and allow the chef more time with loved-ones’.

While the brands customers also told them how alternative meats, and not just turkey, are important to them over the Christmas period too.

A normal roast turkey (pictured) can we hard to cook - as many worry about making sure it is cooked to the right temperature. Stock picture

Their Perfect Beef, which has a roast beef butter, has been butchered to ensure optimum levels of fat - while it can just be popped straight in the oven and doesn't need to be seared.

While they have also increased their vegan options - with their Plant Kitchen festive roast - which combines mushrooms and soya protein, stuffed with cranberry and chestnut stuffing.

Last month the brand admitting that they were slashing prices for bread, milk and other basic foods as it prepares to launch a grocery delivery service to compete with Waitrose.
description: The British high street store said they've created the easy to cook turkey after feedback from over 80,000 customers to uncover the biggest festive food fears.
